c74object.name: bach.fft
c74object.description: Performs the Fast Fourier transform on the incoming llll (whatever its size is), and outputs either the cartesian or the polar representation.

inlet.description: Depending on the object "polar" attribute, this can accept either the incoming amplitudes, or the incoming real parts of the numbers
Depending on the object "polar" attribute, this can accept either the incoming phases (in radiants), or the incoming imaginary parts of the numbers

outlet.digest: Output phases (in radiants) or imaginary (y) parts

method.name: bang
method.description: Perform the FFT operation on the most recently received input value.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Perform the FFT of the incoming llll
method.description: The algorithm performs the FFT on the incoming data, assumed to be a plain llll. The library used to perform such task is kiss_fft.

attribute.name: inv
attribute.description: Perform the inverse FFT, instead of the direct one.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: polar
attribute.description: Output data in polar coordinates, instead of cartesian ones.

c74object.discussion: The algorithm used is the one provided by the library kiss_fft

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: Input amplitudes or real (x) parts. Depending on the object "polar" attribute, this can accept either the incoming amplitudes, or the incoming real parts of the numbers

entry.name: Inlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: Input phases or imaginary (y) parts. Depending on the object "polar" attribute, this can accept either the incoming phases (in radiants), or the incoming imaginary parts of the numbers

entry.name: Outlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: Output phases (in radiants) or imaginary (y) parts.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The algorithm used is the one provided by the library kiss_fft
